BiocHybrid: hybrid data representation methods in Bioconductor

Vincent J. Carey, stvjc at channing.harvard.edu

Source: vignettes/BiocHybrid.Rmd
BiocHybrid.Rmd

Introduction

Let’s consider a basic resource for computational genomic data science: a representation of the human genome.

library(BSgenome.Hsapiens.UCSC.hg38)
hs = BSgenome.Hsapiens.UCSC.hg38
str(hs)
## Formal class 'BSgenome' [package "BSgenome"] with 9 slots
##   ..@ pkgname           : chr "BSgenome.Hsapiens.UCSC.hg38"
##   ..@ single_sequences  :Formal class 'TwobitNamedSequences' [package "BSgenome"] with 1 slot
##   .. .. ..@ twobitfile:Formal class 'TwoBitFile' [package "rtracklayer"] with 1 slot
##   .. .. .. .. ..@ resource: chr "/Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/4.4-arm64/Resources/library/BSgenome.Hsapiens.UCSC.hg38/extdata/single_sequences.2bit"
##   ..@ multiple_sequences:Formal class 'RdaCollection' [package "XVector"] with 2 slots
##   .. .. ..@ dirpath : chr "/Library/Frameworks/R.framework/Versions/4.4-arm64/Resources/library/BSgenome.Hsapiens.UCSC.hg38/extdata"
##   .. .. ..@ objnames: chr(0) 
##   ..@ seqinfo           :Formal class 'Seqinfo' [package "GenomeInfoDb"] with 4 slots
##   .. .. ..@ seqnames   : chr [1:711] "chr1" "chr2" "chr3" "chr4" ...
##   .. .. ..@ seqlengths : int [1:711] 248956422 242193529 198295559 190214555 181538259 170805979 159345973 145138636 138394717 133797422 ...
##   .. .. ..@ is_circular: logi [1:711] FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE FALSE ...
##   .. .. ..@ genome     : chr [1:711] "hg38" "hg38" "hg38" "hg38" ...
##   ..@ user_seqnames     : Named chr [1:711] "chr1" "chr2" "chr3" "chr4" ...
##   .. ..- attr(*, "names")= chr [1:711] "chr1" "chr2" "chr3" "chr4" ...
##   ..@ injectSNPs_handler:Formal class 'InjectSNPsHandler' [package "BSgenome"] with 4 slots
##   .. .. ..@ SNPlocs_pkgname          : chr(0) 
##   .. .. ..@ getSNPcount              :function ()  
##   .. .. ..@ getSNPlocs               :function ()  
##   .. .. ..@ seqname_translation_table: chr(0) 
##   ..@ .seqs_cache       :<environment: 0x1527453e0> 
##   ..@ .link_counts      :<environment: 0x152745108> 
##   ..@ metadata          :List of 6
##   .. ..$ organism    : chr "Homo sapiens"
##   .. ..$ common_name : chr "Human"
##   .. ..$ provider    : chr "UCSC"
##   .. ..$ genome      : chr "hg38"
##   .. ..$ release_date: chr "2023/01/31"
##   .. ..$ source_url  : chr "https://hgdownload.soe.ucsc.edu/goldenPath/hg38/bigZips/p14/"

The 3 billion bases are managed in an S4 class instance pointing to a 2bit-format representation of the genome of size file.size(hs@single_sequences@twobitfile@resource).

The nucleotide sequence for chromosome 17, say, is accessible for interrogation with a familiar “list selector” syntax. The nucleotide content can be explored using the Biostrings package.

hs$chr17
## 83257441-letter DNAString object
## seq: NNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNN...NNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNN
library(Biostrings)
oligonucleotideFrequency(hs$chr17, 1)
##        A        C        G        T 
## 22639499 18723944 18851500 22705261

Chromosomes can be analyzed in parallel.

library(BiocParallel)
register(MulticoreParam(4))
onf = bplapply(names(hs)[1:24], function(x) oligonucleotideFrequency(hs[[x]],1))
ans = do.call(rbind, onf)
rownames(ans) = names(hs)[1:24]
head(ans)
##             A        C        G        T
## chr1 67070277 48055043 48111528 67244164
## chr2 71791213 48318180 48450903 71987932
## chr3 59689091 39233483 39344259 59833302
## chr4 58561236 36236976 36331025 58623430
## chr5 54699094 35731600 35879674 54955010
## chr6 51345477 33646690 33713330 51373025
